comment.author: 17624084@N00
comment._content: who did this? he deserves an award for his mastery to take such a quality shot with the hardware of  1910's(!) - look at the central character is perfectly on focus taking subjects in motion with almost no blurring!

comment.author: 9906615@N08
comment._content: The gentleman's suit was so nicely tailored. And he was sporting a pinkie ring and perfect haircut.  The ladies of his day didn't fare quite so well, it seems.  Those hems!!!  What a treat these are - usually photos taken during this period show not much more than stiff studio poses.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Date written on negative appears to be 5/17/13

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Mrs. Theodore Roosevelt , Jr. was Miss Eleanor Butler Alexander, only daughter of Mrs. Henry Addison Alexander and a great granddaughter of the late Theron Butler. [See query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A0CE2DF1230E233A... NYT June 21, 1910,]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo taken on this occasion shows a different woman identified as Mrs. Roosevelt:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3047672773/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: New York society bluebloods attending the horse races at Belmont Park, on June 17, 1913. A New York Times story (June 18, 1913) reported the roster of winners that day: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9406E...
